revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = Xming | screenshot = [[File:Ubuntu on Windows - running Synaptic and nautilus.png|300px]] | caption = Xming displaying [[Synaptic Package Manager|Synaptic]] and [[Nautilus (file manager)|Nautilus]] | developer = Colin Harrison | latest_release_version = 6.9.0.31 | latest_release_date = public release, {{release date and age|2007|5|4}} | latest_preview_version = 7.5.0.40 | latest_preview_date = limited to donors, {{release date and age|2011|09|30}} | operating_system = [[Microsoft Windows]] XP/2003/Vista/7 | website = http://sourceforge.net/projects/xming }}
'''Xming''' is an [[porting|implementation]] of the [[X Window System]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] operating systems, including [[Windows XP]], [[Windows Server 2003]], [[Windows Vista]] <ref name="linuxcom">{{cite web |url=http://www.linux.com/archive/feature/118106|title=Use Linux over Windows with Xming|publisher=Linux.com|author=Joe 'Zonker' Brockmeier|date=2007-08-08|accessdate=2009-06-08}}</ref><ref name="novell">{{cite web|url=http://www.novell.com/coolsolutions/tip/18137.html|title=Xming - A X Server for Windows|publisher=Novell|author=David Mair|date=2006-11-22|accessdate=2009-06-09}}</ref> and [[Windows 7]].<ref>http://www.straightrunning.com/XmingNotes/</ref>
==Features== Xming provides the X Window System display server, a set of traditional sample X applications and tools, and a set of fonts. It features support of several languages and has [[Mesa 3D]], [[OpenGL]], and [[GLX]] [[3D Computer Graphics|3D graphics extensions]]<ref name="linuxcom" /> capabilities.
The Xming X server is based on the [[X.Org Server]]. It is cross-compiled on [[Linux]] with the [[MinGW]] compiler suite and the Pthreads-Win32 multi-threading library. XMing runs natively on Windows and does not need any third-party emulation software.
Xming may be used with implementations of [[Secure Shell]] (SSH) to securely forward X11 sessions from other computers.<ref name="novell" /> It supports [[PuTTY]] and ''ssh.exe'', and comes with a version of PuTTY's plink.exe. The Xming project also offers a portable version of PuTTY.
The software has been recommended by authors of books on free software when a free X server is needed,<ref>Van Vugt 2009:273</ref><ref>Garrido 2007:366</ref> and described as simple<ref>Iskander 2007:41</ref> and easier to install though less configurable than other popular free choices like [[Cygwin/X]].<ref>Peckar 2008:182</ref>
==Licensing==
Xming was previously distributed with a series of [[software license]]s which included statements construed by reviewers as indicating that distribution was permitted under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License|GNU General Public License (GPL)]], but which set further restrictions. The [[Free Software Foundation]] stated to one such reviewer that such distribution was a violation of the terms of the GPL.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blue-gnu.biz/content/fsf_confirms_xming_restrictions_not_allowed|title=FSF Confirms Xming Restrictions Not Allowed|publisher=Blue-gnu.biz|date=2007-11-16|accessdate=2011-01-18|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080430161402/http://blue-gnu.biz/content/fsf_confirms_xming_restrictions_not_allowed|archivedate=2008-04-30}}</ref> The Xming license was later altered to remove the reference to the GPL.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blue-gnu.biz/content/blue_gnu_wrong_about_xming_xming_no_longer_gpl |title=Blue GNU Wrong About Xming - Xming No Longer GPL|publisher=Blue-gnu.biz |date=2007-11-19 |accessdate=2010-08-28|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20071222033943/http://blue-gnu.biz/content/blue_gnu_wrong_about_xming_xming_no_longer_gpl|archivedate=2007-12-22}}</ref>
==Newer Releases==
Donations must be made to download new releases, (since May 2007).<ref>http://www.straightrunning.com/XmingNotes/#head-12</ref> Making a donation will allow the user access to new downloads for one year. However releases listed as "Public Domain" can still be downloaded with no donation, the same public releases are hosted on sourceforge <ref>http://sourceforge.net/projects/xming/</ref>. As of writing this public release works on Windows 7 x64.
{{quote|5. Private individuals using Xming non-commercially, who want to use Xming Website Releases as sole user, will be given access to them for one year after making a small Donation to help fund the replacement equipment needed to further Xming development.<ref name="yearly">{{cite web|url=http://www.straightrunning.com/XmingNotes/term.php|title=Xming's Terms and Conditions|work=Xming|accessdate=October 13, 2009}}</ref>|Clarifications|XMing's Terms and Conditions}}
